result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jayon M Hayes

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jayon M Hayes in court.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court for Jayon M Hayes.  Attorney William T. Berens in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for jury trial first call. Discussion held as to posture of the case. State cannot proceed on count 1. Defense moves to dismiss count 1. State does not object. Court DISMISSES count 1 without prejudice. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date for count 2. Case adjourned. Case remains calendared in Br 4. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Jayon M Hayes in court.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court for Jayon M Hayes.  Attorney William T. Berens in court for State of Wisconsin. Final Pretrial held. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial, Branch 4.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant Jayon M Hayes in court.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court for Jayon M Hayes.  Attorney William T. Berens appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for final pretrial, however parties requests additional final pretrial. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine, received and filed.
All previous ordered conditions to remain.

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court, defendant Jayon M Hayes not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advises of victim notification. Arguments heard. Court orders $4,000.00 cash bail.   Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by the final pretrial date. Court orders suppression motion due by 7-22-2022. Any other motions and notice of alibi must be filed by the final pretrial.  Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 4.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of & Motion to Modify Bail.

Defendant Jayon M Hayes in court with Attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Jayon M Hayes in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 04, Judge Hanrahan. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Br. 04.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 053379,
Payable Number: 1011723,
Receipt Number: 22RP023042,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered no contact with MAS and SDE
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jayon M Hayes in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Jayon M Hayes in custody.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jayon M Hayes appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
